sense.def:
To be standing
pomeni imeti vzravnano telo, ravne noge, težo pa podpirajo stopala.

seg.quote: She was standing at the bus stop.
I stood very still, hoping they wouldn't see me.

sense.def:
To stand
pomeni spremeniti svoj položaj, tako da stojimo in ne sedimo;

seg.quote: One by one, he asked each graduate to stand.

sense.def:
To stand aside
ali
to stand back
pomeni premakniti se na drug kraj nedaleč proč.

seg.quote: Miss Darke told the girls to stand aside.
He stood back and surveyed his handiwork.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
stands somewhere
, je na določenem kraju v navpičnem položaju.

seg.quote: In the middle of the town stands a splendid Victorian building.
Only one of the houses is still standing.

sense.def:
To stand something somewhere
pomeni nekaj dati v navpičen položaj.

seg.quote: He stood the bottle on the bench beside him.

sense.def:
Kadar odločitev ali ponudba
stands
, je še veljavna.

seg.quote: Fifty years later, this Supreme Court ruling still stands.

sense.def:
Izraz
stand
lahko uporabimi namesto
is
za opisovanje stanja ali položaja nečesa.

seg.quote: His real intentions now stand revealed.
They are dissatisfied with the law as it stands.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
can stand a situation or a test
, je dovolj dobro ali močno, da se upre določenim okoliščinam ali preskusu.

seg.quote: The economy couldn't stand another rise in interest rates.
Her arguments could hardly stand close inspection.

sense.def:
I cannot stand something
rečemo, kadar nas nekaj tako jezi, da tistega ne moremo prenašati.

seg.quote: He kept on nagging until I couldn't stand it any longer.
She can't stand children.

sense.def:
To stand to gain or lose something
pomeni, da bomo verjetno nekaj pridobili ali izgubili.

seg.quote: Other groups stand to make a profit out of it.
Few people are yet aware of how much we stand to lose by this agreement.

sense.def:
To stand in an election
pomeni biti kandidat na volitvah.

seg.quote: She was invited to stand as the Liberal candidate.
He has stood for Parliament 21 times.

sense.def:
A stand
je majhna prodajalna ali stojnica.

seg.quote: ...a hamburger stand.
...an information stand.

sense.def:
A stand
je tudi predmet ali kos pohištva, namenjen za spravilo določene vrste predmetov.

seg.quote: ...an umbrella stand.
...a music stand.

sense.def:
Kadar nekoga vprašamo,
how they stand
ali
where they stand
, ga sprašujemo po njegovem mnenju ali odnosu v določenih okoliščinah.

seg.quote: There was never any doubt about where he stood on the racial issue.

sense.def:
To take a stand
ali
to make a stand
pomeni upreti se poskusom, da bi nas premagali ali prisilili, da bi si premislili.

seg.quote: It's an important issue and you must be prepared to take a stand on it.
If they keep doing that, it stands to reason that the police are going to get suspicious.

sense.def:
To stand trial
pomeni, da nam sodijo na sodišču.

seg.quote: He has come back to stand trial on a murder charge.
Hearne had not yet taken the stand.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj, kar je mogoče izmeriti,
stands at a particular level
, je na določeni ravni.

seg.quote: Unemployment in North Wales now stands at 38%.

sense.def:
To stand by
pomeni biti pripravljen pomagati ali ukrepati, če bi bilo treba.

seg.quote: Stand by with lots of water in case a fire breaks out.

sense.def:
To stand by
pomeni dovoliti, da se zgodi nekaj hudega, in ne storiti ničesar, da bi to preprečili.

seg.quote: We cannot stand by and watch while our allies are attacked.

sense.def:
To stand by someone
pomeni nekoga podpreti, kadar je v stiski.

seg.quote: If they try to make you resign, we'll stand by you.

sense.def:
To stand by an earlier decision or agreement
pomeni držati se prejšnje odločitve ali trditve.

seg.quote: I said I would do it and I stand by my promise.

sense.def:
To stand down
pomeni dati odpoved.

seg.quote: She was prepared to stand down in favour of a younger candidate.

sense.def:
Kadar neka črka
stands for a particular word
, je okrajšava določene besede.

seg.quote: T.E.C. stands for Technical Education Certificate.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
stands for certain ideas or attitudes
, podpira ali predstavlja določene zamisli ali pristop.

seg.quote: I disagreed fundamentally with what the party stood for.

sense.def:
I will not stand for something
rečemo, kadar hočemo povedati, da nečesa ne bomo trpeli.

seg.quote: The Army would not stand for it much longer.

sense.def:
To stand in for someone
pomeni zavzeti mesto nekoga drugega ali opraviti njegovo delo.

seg.quote: He was standing in for his younger brother.
You will stand in for me, John?

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
stands out
, je zelo jasno vidno.

seg.quote: The name on the van stood out clearly.

sense.def:
Kadar neko vprašanje ali dosežek
stands out
, je veliko boljši ali pomembnejši kot druge, podobne stvari.

seg.quote: One issue stood out as especially important.
One article in this collection stands out from all the others.

sense.def:
To stand up
pomeni spremeniti svoj položaj, tako da stojimo in ne sedimo.

seg.quote: I put down my glass and stood up.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
stands up to rough treatment
, pomeni, da tistemu grobo ravnanje ne škoduje ali ga ne poškoduje.

seg.quote: This carpet stands up to the wear and tear of continual use.

sense.def:
To stand up to someone
pomeni braniti se pred napadi ali zahtevami določene osebe.

cit.quote: postaviti se po robu, upreti se

seg.quote: Maybe if I stood up to him, he'd back down.

sense.def:
To stand up for someone or something
pomeni braniti nekoga ali nekaj pred kritiko.

seg.quote: ...people who stood up for human rights.
I'm glad to see that he's standing up for himself.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj, na primer zahteva ali dokaz,
stands up
, je sprejeto kot resnično ali zadovoljivo.

seg.quote: The prosecution had no evidence which would stand up in a court of law.

sense.def:
To be stood up by a boyfriend or girlfriend
pomeni, da fant ali dekle ne prideta na zmenek z nami;
